title: Perfect
comment: I created my Google plus account just to make this comment. This app is simple but yet covers just about any scenario you may have with your phone in regard to desired auto brightness levels. Awesome work.  Install ,go to a dark environment and set your minimum brightness setting within the app. Next.go to a semi bright environment and adjust the "manual adjustment"  located within the app to where  the screen is just bright enough for you. Next go to a fairly bright area and set your maximum brightness level that will be needed. On to night mode settings. Turn night mode brightness up all the way to start,Next turn on auto mode brightness.Go to a dark environment..Slide down the night mode threshold slider just until night mode kicks in.>if you are having trouble finding just the right spot then tick mark low night mode values which will make values of tenths possible. Next lower the the night mode brightness slider to the desired brightness level you want night mode to be. Done.

title: How the Android auto brightness should work
comment: Not happy with the range of the phones auto brightness? YAAB works as an efficient app to set brightness level automatically with a pretty good hit rate. Permission required for YAAB are only the ones essential for the function of the app. Resources usage is reasonable. Checkmark at Persist Notification makes it stable for me. Wishes: 1. Number values on the brightness ranges settings for better reproducibility, 2. A screen short-cut to temporarily increase the screen brightness without changing the apps settings. But these are not essential, please keep things clean and simple. No changing skins, no esoteric settings we only try once anyway.   Peter Kroll, Singapore

comment: Simple and efficient, does exactly what it should. Simple interface and easy to use.
It's great so far

title: Love it!
comment: Can't use my phone at night without it! It's really can protect my eyes from strong light.

title: Nice
comment: This is a great and simple to use app. If I can only suggest that the notification should have night mode switching or maybe even the slider but other than that this is an awesome app.

title: Best of the bunch
comment: I tried several auto brightness tools and found this one to work the best with my Chinese Galaxy clone. It has got very good low - light sensitivity eg it seemed to alter the brightness at more accurate parameters than some other apps did. One problem (possibly unique to my phone) I found was it seemed to use extra battery drain which was not what the original intention was. EG under battery use, it was one of the higher drains similar to wifi on. Because of this characteristic I uninstalled it.  TIP - If you are using Android 4.1 you can improve its standard Auto light performance by unchecking auto in settings, adjusting the slider down to near minimum light, then recheck auto adjust. It then gives much better low-light adjustment without any other utility.

title: Works well
comment: I wish it had controls more like lux rather than in notifications.

title: Time Based
comment: The night mode sometimes gets in the way during daytime. It wold be nice if we could set it to turn on at a certain time. That would make more sense.

title: Really Useful
comment: A great little app for tweaking your auto brightness levels and providing you a strict night time mode. Will enhance battery life and overall usability of your phone, stopping ti from getting too bright or too dim.  XDA - IIIIkoolaidIIII
